cluster.name: Demand Response and Load Control
cluster.description: This cluster provides an interface to the functionality of Smart Energy Demand Response and Load Control. Devices targeted by this cluster include thermostats and devices that support load control.

command.name: LoadControlEvent
command.description: Command description for LoadControlEvent

command.name: CancelLoadControlEvent
command.description: Command description for CancelLoadControlEvent

command.name: CancelAllLoadControlEvents
command.description: Command description for CancelAllLoadControlEvents

command.name: ReportEventStatus
command.description: Command description for ReportEventStatus

command.name: GetScheduledEvents
command.description: Command description for GetScheduledEvents

cluster.name: Simple Metering
cluster.description: The Metering Cluster provides a mechanism to retrieve usage information from Electric, Gas, Water, and potentially Thermal metering devices.

command.name: GetProfileResponse
command.description: Command description for GetProfileResponse

command.name: RequestMirror
command.description: Command description for RequestMirror

command.name: RemoveMirror
command.description: Command description for RemoveMirror

command.name: RequestFastPollModeResponse
command.description: Command sent as a response to fast poll request.

command.name: ConfigureMirror
command.description: Command to configure a mirror to understand notification schemes and all associated behavior.

command.name: ConfigureNotificationScheme
command.description: This command is sent to the mirror once the mirror has been created. The command deals with the operational configuration of the Mirror and the device that reports to the mirror. No default schemes are allowed to be overwritten.

command.name: ConfigureNotificationFlags
command.description: The ConfigureNotificationFlags command is used to set the commands relating to the bit value for each NotificationFlags attribute that the scheme is proposing to use.

command.name: GetNotificationFlag
command.description: The GetNotificationFlag command is used only when a BOMD is being mirrored. This command provides a method for the BOMD to notify the Mirror message queue that it wants to receive commands that the Mirror has queued. The Notification flags set within the command shall inform the mirror of the commands that the BOMD is requesting.

command.name: GetProfile
command.description: Command description for GetProfile

command.name: RequestMirrorResponse
command.description: Command description for RequestMirrorResponse

command.name: MirrorRemoved
command.description: Command description for MirrorRemoved

command.name: RequestFastPollMode
command.description: Command to request fast poll mode.

cluster.name: Price
cluster.description: The Price Cluster provides the mechanism for communicating Gas, Energy, or Water pricing information within the premise.

command.name: PublishPrice
command.description: Command description for PublishPrice

command.name: PublishConversionFactor
command.description: The PublishConversionFactor command is sent in response to a GetConversionFactor command or if a new Conversion factor is available.

command.name: PublishCalorificValue
command.description: The PublishCalorificValue command is sent in response to a GetCalorificValue command or if a new calorific value is available.

command.name: GetCurrentPrice
command.description: Command description for GetCurrentPrice

command.name: GetScheduledPrices
command.description: Command description for GetScheduledPrices

command.name: PriceAcknowledgement
command.description: Command description for PriceAcknowledgement

command.name: GetBlockPeriods
command.description: Command description for GetBlockPeriod(s)

command.name: GetConversionFactor
command.description: This command initiates a PublishConversionFactor command for the scheduled conversion factor updates.

command.name: GetCalorificValue
command.description: This command initiates a PublishCalorificValue command for the scheduled conversion factor updates.

cluster.name: Messaging
cluster.description: This cluster provides an interface for passing text messages between SE devices.

command.name: DisplayMessage
command.description: Command description for DisplayMessage

command.name: CancelMessage
command.description: Command description for CancelMessage

command.name: GetLastMessage
command.description: Command description for GetLastMessage

command.name: MessageConfirmation
command.description: Command description for MessageConfirmation

cluster.name: Tunneling
cluster.description: The tunneling cluster provides an interface for tunneling protocols.

command.name: RequestTunnel
command.description: RequestTunnel is the client command used to setup a tunnel association with the server. The request payload specifies the protocol identifier for the requested tunnel, a manufacturer code in case of proprietary protocols and the use of flow control for streaming protocols.

command.name: CloseTunnel
command.description: Client command used to close the tunnel with the server. The parameter in the payload specifies the tunnel identifier of the tunnel that has to be closed. The server leaves the tunnel open and the assigned resources allocated until the client sends the CloseTunnel command or the CloseTunnelTimeout fires.

command.name: TransferDataClientToServer
command.description: Command that indicates (if received) that the client has sent data to the server. The data itself is contained within the payload.

command.name: TransferDataErrorClientToServer
command.description: This command is generated by the receiver of a TransferData command if the tunnel status indicates that something is wrong. There are two three cases in which TransferDataError is sent: (1) The TransferData received contains a TunnelID that does not match to any of the active tunnels of the receiving device. This could happen if a (sleeping) device sends a TransferData command to a tunnel that has been closed by the server after the CloseTunnelTimeout. (2) The TransferData received contains a proper TunnelID of an active tunnel, but the device sending the data does not match to it. (3) The TransferData received contains more data than indicated by the MaximumIncomingTransferSize of the receiving device.

command.name: AckTransferDataClientToServer
command.description: Command sent in response to each TransferData command in case - and only in case - flow control has been requested by the client in the TunnelRequest command and is supported by both tunnel endpoints. The response payload indicates the number of octets that may still be received by the receiver.

command.name: ReadyDataClientToServer
command.description: The ReadyData command is generated - after a receiver had to stop the dataflow using the AckTransferData(0) command - to indicate that the device is now ready to continue receiving data. The parameter NumberOfOctetsLeft gives a hint on how much space is left for the next data transfer. The ReadyData command is only issued if flow control is enabled.

command.name: GetSupportedTunnelProtocols
command.description: Get Supported Tunnel Protocols is the client command used to determine the Tunnel protocols supported on another device.

command.name: RequestTunnelResponse
command.description: RequestTunnelResponse is sent by the server in response to a RequestTunnel command previously received from the client. The response contains the status of the RequestTunnel command and a tunnel identifier corresponding to the tunnel that has been set-up in the server in case of success.

command.name: TransferDataServerToClient
command.description: Command that transfers data from server to the client. The data itself has to be placed within the payload.

command.name: TransferDataErrorServerToClient
command.description: This command is generated by the receiver of a TransferData command if the tunnel status indicates that something is wrong. There are two three cases in which TransferDataError is sent: (1) The TransferData received contains a TunnelID that does not match to any of the active tunnels of the receiving device. This could happen if a (sleeping) device sends a TransferData command to a tunnel that has been closed by the server after the CloseTunnelTimeout. (2) The TransferData received contains a proper TunnelID of an active tunnel, but the device sending the data does not match to it. (3) The TransferData received contains more data than indicated by the MaximumIncomingTransferSize of the receiving device.

command.name: AckTransferDataServerToClient
command.description: Command sent in response to each TransferData command in case - and only in case - flow control has been requested by the client in the TunnelRequest command and is supported by both tunnel endpoints. The response payload indicates the number of octets that may still be received by the receiver.

command.name: ReadyDataServerToClient
command.description: The ReadyData command is generated - after a receiver had to stop the dataflow using the AckTransferData(0) command - to indicate that the device is now ready to continue receiving data. The parameter NumberOfOctetsLeft gives a hint on how much space is left for the next data transfer. The ReadyData command is only issued if flow control is enabled.

command.name: SupportedTunnelProtocolsResponse
command.description: Supported Tunnel Protocol Response is sent in response to a Get Supported Tunnel Protocols command previously received. The response contains a list of Tunnel protocols supported by the device; the payload of the response should be capable of holding up to 16 protocols.

command.name: TunnelClosureNotification
command.description: TunnelClosureNotification is sent by the server to indicate that a tunnel has been closed due to expiration of a CloseTunnelTimeout.

clusterExtension.attribute: number of price tiers in use
number of block thresholds in use
domestic fuel tax rate trailing digit
ex number of price tiers in use
ex number of block thresholds in use
ex last billing period consolidated bill

command.name: PublishBlockPeriod
command.description: The PublishBlockPeriod command is generated in response to receiving a GetBlockPeriod(s) command or when an update to the block tariff schedule is available from the commodity provider.

command.name: PublishTariffInformation
command.description: The PublishTariffInformation command is sent in response to a GetTariffInformation command or if new tariff information is available (including price matrix and block thresholds).

command.name: PublishPriceMatrix
command.description: PublishPriceMatrix command is used to publish the Block Price Information Set (up to 15 tiers x 15 blocks) and the Extended Price Information Set (up to 48 tiers). The PublishPriceMatrix command is sent in response to a GetPriceMatrix command.

command.name: PublishBlockThresholds
command.description: The PublishBlockThreshold command is sent in response to a GetBlockThreshold command.

command.name: PublishCO2Value
command.description: The PublishCO2Value command is sent in response to a GetCO2Value command or if a new CO2 conversion factor is available.

command.name: PublishTierLabels
command.description: The PublishTierLabels command is generated in response to receiving a GetTierLabels command or when there is a tier label change.

command.name: PublishBillingPeriod
command.description: The PublishBillingPeriod command is generated in response to receiving a GetBillingPeriod(s) command or when an update to the Billing schedule is available from the commodity Supplier.

command.name: PublishConsolidatedBill
command.description: The PublishConsolidatedBill command is used to make consolidated billing information of previous billing periods available to other end devices. This command is issued in response to a GetConsolidatedBill command or if new billing information is available.

command.name: PublishCppEvent
command.description: The PublishCPPEvent command is sent from an ESI to its price clients to notify them of a Critical Peak Pricing event.

command.name: PublishCreditPayment
command.description: The PublishCreditPayment command is used to update the credit payment information is available.

command.name: PublishCurrencyConversion
command.description: The PublishCurrencyConversion command is sent in response to a GetCurrencyConversion command or when a new currency becomes available.

command.name: CancelTariff
command.description: The CancelTariff command indicates that all data associated with a particular tariff instance should be discarded.

command.name: GetTariffInformation
command.description: This command initiates a PublishTariffInformation command for the scheduled tariff updates.

command.name: GetPriceMatrix
command.description: This command initiates a PublishPriceMatrix command for the scheduled Price Matrix updates.

command.name: GetBlockThresholds
command.description: This command initiates a PublishBlockThreshold command for the scheduled Block Threshold updates.

command.name: GetCO2Value
command.description: This command initiates a PublishCO2Value command for the scheduled CO2 conversion factor updates.

command.name: GetTierLabels
command.description: This command allows a client to retrieve the tier labels associated with a given tariff; this command initiates a PublishTierLabels command from the server.

command.name: GetBillingPeriod
command.description: This command initiates one or more PublishBillingPeriod commands for the currently scheduled billing periods.

command.name: GetConsolidatedBill
command.description: This command initiates one or more PublishConsolidatedBill commands with the requested billing information.

command.name: CppEventResponse
command.description: The CPPEventResponse command is sent from a Client (IPD) to the ESI to notify them of a Critical Peak Pricing event authorisation.

command.name: GetCreditPayment
command.description: This command initiates PublishCreditPayment commands for the requested credit payment information.

command.name: GetCurrencyConversionCommand
command.description: This command initiates a PublishCurrencyConversion command for the currency conversion factor updates. A server shall be capable of storing both the old and the new currencies.

command.name: GetTariffCancellation
command.description: This command initiates the return of the last CancelTariff command held on the associated server.

current no tier block 6 summation received
current no tier block 7 summation received

current no tier block 12 summation received
current no tier block 13 summation received
current no tier block 14 summation received
current no tier block 15 summation received

command.name: ScheduleSnapshotResponse
command.description: This command is used to tell the cluster server to take a snapshot.

command.name: TakeSnapshotResponse
command.description: This command is used to respond to manual requests to take a snapshot.

command.name: PublishSnapshot
command.description: This command is used to send snapshot data to the client.

command.name: GetSampledDataResponse
command.description: This command is used to send the requested sample data to the client. It is generated in response to a GetSampledData command.

command.name: ScheduleSnapshot
command.description: This command is used to set up a schedule of when the device shall create snapshot data.

command.name: TakeSnapshot
command.description: This command is used to tell the cluster server to take a snapshot.

command.name: GetSnapshot
command.description: This command is used to request the cluster server for snapshot data.

command.name: StartSampling
command.description: The sampling mechanism allows a set of samples of the specified type of data to be taken, commencing at the stipulated start time. This mechanism may run concurrently with the capturing of profile data, and may refer the same parameters, albeit possibly at a different sampling rate.

command.name: GetSampledData
command.description: This command is used to request sampled data from the server.Note that it is the responsibility of the client to ensure that it does not request more samples than can be held in a single command payload.

command.name: MirrorReportAttributeResponse
command.description: This command is sent in response to the ReportAttribute command when the corresponding Enable Bit of the MirrorControl attribute is set.

command.name: ResetLoadLimitCounter
command.description: The ResetLoadLimitCounter command shall cause the LoadLimitCounter attribute to be reset.

cluster.name: Prepayment
cluster.description: The Prepayment Cluster provides the facility to pass messages relating to prepayment between devices on the HAN.

command.name: SelectAvailableEmergencyCredit
command.description: This command is sent to the Metering Device to activate the use of any Emergency Credit available on the Metering Device.

command.name: ChangeDebt
command.description: The ChangeDebt command is send to the Metering Device to change the fuel or Non fuel debt values.

command.name: EmergencyCreditSetup
command.description: This command is a method to set up the parameters for the emergency credit.

command.name: ConsumerTopUp
command.description: The ConsumerTopUp command is used by the IPD and the ESI as a method of applying credit top up values to the prepayment meter.

command.name: CreditAdjustment
command.description: The CreditAdjustment command is sent to update the accounting base for the Prepayment meter.

command.name: ChangePaymentMode
command.description: This command is sent to a Metering Device to instruct it to change its mode of operation. i.e. from Credit to Prepayment.

command.name: GetPrepaySnapshot
command.description: This command is used to request the cluster server for snapshot data.

command.name: GetTopUpLog
command.description: This command is sent to the Metering Device to retrieve the log of Top Up codes received by the meter.

command.name: SetLowCreditWarningLevel
command.description: This command is sent to the Metering Device to set the warning level for low credit. It can be sent from either the HES or the IHU.

command.name: GetDebtRepaymentyLog
command.description: This command is used to request the contents of the repayment log.

command.name: SetMaximumCreditLimit
command.description: This command is sent from a client to the Prepayment server to set the maximum credit level allowed in the meter.

command.name: SetOverallDebtCap
command.description: This command is sent from a client to the Prepayment server to set the overall debt cap allowed in the meter.

command.name: GetPrepaySnapshotResponse
command.description: This command is used to send snapshot data to the client.

command.name: ChangePaymentModeResponse
command.description: This command is send in response to the ChangePaymentMode Command.

command.name: ConsumerTopUpResponse
command.description: Metering device responses either with amount available in the Top Up and Credit remaining after addition of this Top Up when Top up code is supplied or with supply status (after implementation) when connect/disconnect top up code is supplied.

command.name: GetCommand
command.description: The Get Command is used only when a BOMD Meter is being mirrored.

command.name: PublishTopUpLog
command.description: This command is used to send the Top Up Code Log entries to the client.

command.name: PublishDebtLog
command.description: This command is used to send the contents of the repayment log.

command.name: ReportEventStatus
command.description: This command is reused from the DRLC cluster. This command is generated in response to the Manage Event command.

command.name: ManageEvent
command.description: The Manage Event command allows a remote device (such as an IHD or web portal) to change the behavior of a DRLC cluster client when responding to a DRLC Load Control Event.

command.name: PublishCalendar
command.description: The PublishCalendar command is published in response to a GetCalendar command or if new calendar information is available.

command.name: PublishDayProfile
command.description: The PublishDayProfile command is published in response to a GetDayProfile command.

command.name: PublishWeekProfile
command.description: The PublishWeekProfile command is published in response to a GetWeekProfile command.

command.name: PublishSeasons
command.description: The PublishSeasons command is published in response to a GetSeason command.

command.name: PublishSpecialDays
command.description: The PublishSpecialDays command is published in response to a GetSpecialDays command or if a calendar update is available.

command.name: CancelCalendar
command.description: The CancelCalendar command indicates that all data associated with a particular calendar instance should be discarded.

command.name: GetCalendar
command.description: This command initiates PublishCalendar command(s) for scheduled TOU Calendar updates.

command.name: GetDayProfiles
command.description: This command initiates one or more PublishDayProfile commands for the referenced TOU Calendar.

command.name: GetWeekProfiles
command.description: This command initiates one or more PublishWeekProfile commands for the referenced TOU Calendar.

command.name: GetSeasons
command.description: This command initiates one or more PublishSeasons commands for the referenced TOU Calendar.

command.name: GetSpecialDays
command.description: This command initiates one or more PublishSpecialDays commands for the scheduled Special Day Table updates.

command.name: GetCalendarCancellation
command.description: This command initiates the return of the last CancelCalendar command held on the associated server.

cluster.name: Device Management
cluster.attribute: Uncontrolled Flow Threshold Unit of Measure
ex proposed supplier change date time
change of tenancy update date time
extended meter alarm status register changed
disconnection due to cut off valve
physical attack on the prepay meter
electronic attack on the prepay meter
set low credit warning level received
set low credit warning level actioned
set low credit warning level cancelled
set low credit warning level rejected
device management disconnection due to tamper

command.name: GetChangeOfTenancy
command.description: This command is used to request the ESI to update any device that is bound to it when the next change of Tenancy is.

command.name: GetChangeOfSupplier
command.description: This command is used to request the ESI to update any device that is bound to it when the next change of Supplier is.

command.name: GetChangeSupply
command.description: This command is used to request the ESI to update any device that is bound to it what the last change in supply was or is pending.

command.name: SupplyStatusResponse
command.description: This command is transmitted by a Metering Device in response to a Change Supply command.

command.name: RequestNewPassword
command.description: This command is used to request the current password from the server.

command.name: GetSiteId
command.description: This command is used to request the ESI to respond with information regarding any pending change of Site ID.

command.name: ReportEventConfiguration
command.description: This command is sent in response to a GetEventConfiguration command.

command.name: GetUncontrolledFlowThreshold
command.description: This command is used to request the ESI to the current Uncontrolled Flow Rate configuration data.

command.name: PublishChangeOfTenancy
command.description: This command is used to change the tenancy of a meter.

command.name: PublishChangeOfSupplier
command.description: This command is used to change the Supplier (energy supplier) that is supplying the meter (s).

command.name: ChangeSupply
command.description: This command is sent to the Metering Device to instruct it to change the status of the valve or disconnector, i.e. the Supply.

command.name: RequestNewPasswordResponse
command.description: This command is used to send the current password the client.

command.name: LocalChangeSupply
command.description: This command is a simplified version of the change supply command intended to be sent from an IPD to a meter as the consequence of a user action on the IPD.

command.name: UpdateSiteId
command.description: This command is used to set the siteID.

command.name: SetSupplyStatus
command.description: This command is used to specify the required status of the supply following the occurance of certain events on the meter. The meter shall check these requirements to understand whether the supply should be disabled or enabled following one of these events.

command.name: SetEventConfiguration
command.description: This command provides a method to set the event configuration attributes, held in a client device.

command.name: GetEventConfiguration
command.description: This command allows the server to request details of event configurations.

command.name: PublishUncontrolledFlowThreshold
command.description: This command is used to update the ‘Uncontrolled Flow Rate’ configuration data used by flow meters.

command.name: GetEventLog
command.description: The GetEventLog command allows a client to request events from a server’s event logs. One or more PublishEventLog commands are returned on receipt of this command.

command.name: ClearEventLog
command.description: The ClearEventLog command clears the contents of the specified event log.

command.name: PublishEvent
command.description: The PublishEvent command is generated upon an event trigger from within the reporting device and, if supported, the associated Event Configuration attribute in the Device Management cluster.

command.name: PublishEventLog
command.description: This command is generated on receipt of a GetEventLog command. The command returns the most recent event first and up to the number of events requested.

command.name: PairingResponse
command.description: The Pairing Response command provides a device joining a MDU network with a list of the devices that will constitute the ‘virtual HAN’ for the household in which the joining device is to operate.

command.name: PairingRequest
command.description: The Pairing Request command allows a device joining a MDU network to determine the devices that will constitute the ‘virtual HAN’ for the household in which it is to operate.

command.name: InitiateKeyEstablishmentRequest
command.description: Command description for InitiateKeyEstablishmentRequest

command.name: EphemeralDataRequest
command.description: Command description for EphemeralDataRequest

command.name: ConfirmKeyDataRequest
command.description: Command description for ConfirmKeyDataRequest

command.name: TerminateKeyEstablishment
command.description: Command description for TerminateKeyEstablishment

command.name: InitiateKeyEstablishmentResponse
command.description: Command description for InitiateKeyEstablishmentResponse

command.name: EphemeralDataResponse
command.description: Command description for EphemeralDataResponse

command.name: ConfirmKeyDataResponse
command.description: Command description for ConfirmKeyDataResponse
